psalm.title: Psalms

first_reading.text:
[[1_Jn 3,11]]Beloved: This is the message you have heard from the beginning: we should love one another,
[[1_Jn 3,12]]unlike Cain who belonged to the evil one and slaughtered his brother. Why did he slaughter him? Because his own works were evil, and those of his brother righteous.
[[1_Jn 3,13]]Do not be amazed, (then,) brothers, if the world hates you.
[[1_Jn 3,14]]We know that we have passed from death to life because we love our brothers. Whoever does not love remains in death.
[[1_Jn 3,15]]Everyone who hates his brother is a murderer, and you know that no murderer has eternal life remaining in him.
[[1_Jn 3,16]]The way we came to know love was that he laid down his life for us; so we ought to lay down our lives for our brothers.
[[1_Jn 3,17]]If someone who has worldly means sees a brother in need and refuses him compassion, how can the love of God remain in him?
[[1_Jn 3,18]]Children, let us love not in word or speech but in deed and truth.
[[1_Jn 3,19]](Now) this is how we shall know that we belong to the truth and reassure our hearts before him
[[1_Jn 3,20]]in whatever our hearts condemn, for God is greater than our hearts and knows everything.
[[1_Jn 3,21]]Beloved, if (our) hearts do not condemn us, we have confidence in God
first_reading.title: First Letter of John

gospel.text:
[[Jn 1,43]]Jesus decided to go to Galilee, and he found Philip. And Jesus said to him, "Follow me."
[[Jn 1,44]]Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the town of Andrew and Peter.
[[Jn 1,45]]Philip found Nathanael and told him, "We have found the one about whom Moses wrote in the law, and also the prophets, Jesus, son of Joseph, from Nazareth."
[[Jn 1,46]]But Nathanael said to him, "Can anything good come from Nazareth?" Philip said to him, "Come and see."
[[Jn 1,47]]Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward him and said of him, "Here is a true Israelite. There is no duplicity in him."
[[Jn 1,48]]Nathanael said to him, "How do you know me?" Jesus answered and said to him, "Before Philip called you, I saw you under the fig tree."
[[Jn 1,49]]Nathanael answered him, "Rabbi, you are the Son of God; you are the King of Israel."
[[Jn 1,50]]Jesus answered and said to him, "Do you believe because I told you that I saw you under the fig tree? You will see greater things than this."
[[Jn 1,51]]And he said to him, "Amen, amen, I say to you, you will see the sky opened and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
